abstract: United Nations Security Council diplomats fail to come to agreement on what to do about peacekeeping troops in South Sudan, which have faced harsh criticism for failing to protect civilians effectively; officials warn of renewed violence between warring factions in civil war.

headline.print_headline: U.N. Strains to Fix Peacekeeping Shield for South Sudan Civilians
headline.main: What Can the United Nations Do When its Troops Can’t, or Won’t, Protect Civilians?

keywords.value: War Crimes, Genocide and Crimes Against Humanity
keywords.name: subject

snippet: The United Nations Security Council says it wants peacekeepers to protect civilians in South Sudan, but it faces blistering criticism there....
lead_paragraph: The United Nations Security Council says it wants peacekeepers to protect civilians in South Sudan, but it faces blistering criticism there.
